newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HSBC's Marine Midland buys First Fed S&L.
newsitem.headline: HSBC's Marine Midland buys First Fed S&L.

text.p: HSBC Holdings Plc said on Thursday its U.S. unit Marine Midland Bank had acquired First Federal Savings and Loan Association of Rochester, New York, for US$620 million.
An HSBC statement said First Federal had US$7.2 billion in assets, 1,600 employees, 79 retail branches in New York state and 15 mortgage origination offices in nine states.

HSBC Americas chief executive Jim Cleave said the acquisition would increase Marine Midland's assets and deposits to US$30 billion and US$22 billion respectively and was the latest in a series of purchases aimed at widening its retail base.
It expected to see come consolidation of branches, operations and jobs in different parts of the state.

"Over the next few months, we will study where our operations overlap. where new opportunities exist and how to combine operations in a way that best balances the needs of our custmers, the bank, the employees and the community."
First Federal employees would be guaranteed jobs for at least one year, Cleave said, while the study is being carried out.
